title: GIFT Nifty up 90 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
summary: Indian equity markets closed Tuesday on a cautious, range-bound note, with profit booking in banking, IT, and healthcare stocks acting as a drag. Analysts anticipate a mildly positive near-term outlook with a consolidative bias, expecting upside to be capped unless a clear breakout above 26,000 occurs.

title: Stocks in news: M&M, LG, Lenskart, BHEL, Titan, Shoppers Stop
summary: Markets ended marginally higher on weekly expiry day, with analysts maintaining a bullish stance and recommending a buy-on-dips strategy. Several companies like M&M, LG, and Titan are in focus due to Q3 results and other corporate developments, including BHEL's government stake sale and RIL's acquisition.

title: Surplus liquidity fuels record parking in SDF
summary: Banks have parked a record ₹4.52 lakh crore in the RBI's Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) at 5% overnight. This strategy allows them to borrow funds at lower rates, around 4.27% from the TREPS market and earn a significant spread by depositing with the central bank. This reflects substantial surplus liquidity in the banking system.

title: Govt launches OFS to divest up to 5% in BHEL
summary: The government is offloading up to 5% of its stake in BHEL through an Offer for Sale, starting with 3% and an option for an additional 2%. Bids open Wednesday for institutional investors and Thursday for retail, with a floor price set at ₹254 per share. This move aims to reduce government holding and boost public ownership and stock liquidity.

title: CRAs need to maintain additional net worth: Sebi
summary: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) mandates credit rating agencies (CRAs) to maintain additional net worth for rating instruments under other financial sector regulators. This move follows industry representations to allow rating of unlisted securities and other financial products, potentially creating synergies and addressing market gaps.

title: After Tiger Global ruling, Income Tax dept sends notices to foreign VCs, PE funds
summary: India's tax department is intensifying scrutiny of foreign investment firms. Following a Supreme Court decision, notices have been issued to several overseas venture capital and private equity houses. The tax office is seeking detailed information about their operations in Mauritius and Singapore.

title: Piramal Finance raises $400 million in ECB from Global, local lenders including Deutsche Bank AG & SMBC
summary: Piramal Finance secured $400 million through an external commercial borrowing (ECB) package from a consortium including Deutsche Bank, SMBC, Axis Bank, DBS, and Far Eastern International Bank. The 42-month facility will see about half the principal repaid as a bullet at maturity, priced at SOFR +175 bps.

title: Maharashtra govt told to pay ₹691 cr to IDRCL in tollway case
summary: India Debt Resolution Co (IDRCL), the managing arm of NARCL, secured a ₹691 crore arbitration award from Bombay High Court-appointed arbitrator Justice JP Devadhar. This is nearly six times the ₹117 crore IDRCL paid to acquire Sion Panvel Tollways’ (SPTPL) debt in 2024, marking one of the first recoveries for the government-backed bad bank since 2022.

title: Banks ease pace of hiring as tech, AI shoulder more tasks
summary: Indian banks are slowing hiring due to automation, AI, and digital tools reducing the need for large staff increases. HDFC Bank added 5,000 employees in December 2025, reaching 2,15,000, while Axis Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank saw declines in headcount.

title: Non deposit taking NBFCs will continue to be under RBI purview says central bank in draft norms
summary: The Reserve Bank of India has clarified new rules for non-banking finance companies. Certain NBFCs with assets under Rs 1000 crore and no customer interaction can seek exemption from registration. However, these firms remain subject to other RBI regulations. Loans from directors or shareholders will be considered public funds. Activities like mutual fund distribution also disqualify them from this exemption.

title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on February 11
summary: Nifty 50, Sensex today: The trends on Gift Nifty also indicate a positive start for the Indian benchmark index. The Gift Nifty was trading around 26,058 level, a premium of nearly 72 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close.

title: Stocks to watch: M&M, Titan, Eicher Motors, BHEL, Grasim among 10 shares in focus today; full list here
summary: Stock market today: On Tuesday, the Indian benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty 50, extended their rally for a third straight session, supported by positive global cues.

title: Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, Dow Jones’ record close to MSCI rejig
summary: Gift Nifty was trading around 26,056 level, a premium of nearly 70 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close, indicating a positive start for the Indian stock market indices.

title: MSCI Rejig: Aditya Birla Capital, L&T Finance included in Global Standard Index; IRCTC removed
summary: MSCI Rejig: The weight of AU Small Finance Bank shares will increase in the index due to a float adjustment. Following the February rebalancing, India’s weight in the MSCI Standard Index remains unchanged at 14.1%.

title: Why this is the coldest crypto winter yet

title: Gold, silver rates today: Gold rate holds above $5,000, silver price near $82. Where are metals headed?
summary: Gold, silver rates today: Spot gold traded marginally higher at $5,065 per ounce, while spot silver surged 1.16% to $81.32 per ounce during the Asian trading hours on February 11.

title: Hero MotoCorp is in fast lane after a good Q3
summary: Management expects double-digit growth for the two-wheeler industry in Q4 and high single-digit growth for FY27, with Hero aiming to outperform the industry.

title: Small investors cut direct stakes in 52% of India Inc in Q3, but mutual funds cushion the blow
summary: With domestic capital still flowing in through mutual fund SIPs, the consensus among experts is that retail investors are changing strategies rather than shunning equities altogether.

title: Google parent Alphabet sells $32 billion in bonds in 24 hours showing credit market appetite for tech, AI players
summary: Alphabet Inc. raised nearly $32 billion in debt to support its AI initiatives, marking record corporate bond sales in sterling and Swiss franc markets. There are concerns over big tech's borrowing impacts on bond valuations.

title: Stock Market LIVE: GIFT Nifty hints at positive start amid mixed cues; Asian markets extend gains

summary: Technical analyst Vinay Rajani of HDFC Securities expects NTPC and CPSEETF to rally to ₹392.50 and ₹111 on the upside, respectively.

title: 'Surprised by market reaction to Kevin Warsh's nomination to the US Fed'
summary: The dollar, said Aditya Bhave, senior US economist at BofA Global Research, will most likely remain the world's reserve currency.
